title: Falling US dollar and global uncertainty spark modern day gold rush | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: The demise of American exceptionalism, a troubled Chinese economy and a falling US dollar have created fear, confusion and a flight to safety for investors in the form of a modern day gold rush. Australia's biggest mining companies and the Commonwealth Bank are expected to produce strong earnings this reporting season. "About six months ago, we were expecting that for the financial year 2026 earnings for the overall ASX 200 would grow only by about 3 per cent. Now, six months later, the expectations for that full year 2026 earnings growth sits above 10 per cent." UBS equity strategist Richard Schellbach said. "We're seeing copper and gold near record highs and that is going to have a really big boost to these companies' margins," fund manager Roger Montgomery said. But analysts say uncertainty around data centre investment, geo-politics and rising interest rates put dark clouds over the rest of the financial year. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Gus disappearance declared major crime, suspect identified | ABC NEWS
description: It's a case that's baffled authorities, shocked the nation and generated international headlines. Now South Australian Police are treating the disappearance of four-year-old Gus Lamont from a remote sheep station as a major crime. More than four months after the little boy was last seen police say they've got a suspect, stressing it's not one of Gus' parents. title: Silver and gold sell-off drags ASX lower, tech and AI stocks plunge | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Concerns about overspending on the "AI arms race" led to another tech sell-off on Wall Street, with Nvidia, Google, Tesla and AMD stocks hit especially hard.  Meanwhile, the value of silver plunged 14% and gold fell further from its record high as bitcoin has erased all its gains since Donald Trump's victory in the 2024 election. description: A fight over wages is looming. Unions are pushing for workers' wages to rise faster than the cost of living. But business is warning that the move could threaten jobs and force companies to cut other expenses. title: Coroner hands down findings as Bondi Junction stabbing inquest concludes | ABC NEWS
description: Findings from the coronial inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack have been handed down, with the coroner making 23 recommendations. It comes just under two years from the day Joel Cauchi murdered six people and injured another 10 in a stabbing rampage at the Sydney shopping centre. title: Hundreds evacuated from Daly River as floodwaters rise at the community | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Live cross with Olivana Lathouris on flood evacuation efforts in Darwin.   01:40 Hundreds of evacuees have been bused out of the flood zone from Daly River, more than 200 kilometres to safety in the Northern Territory capital.  Now in Darwin, evacuees have a nervous wait, to see how badly the flood waters will impact their community and their belongings left behind. Matt Garrick has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Seven members of parliament storm-out over incoming NT administrator | ABC NEWS
description: Seven members of the Northern Territory parliament have staged a walk out during question time today, over the selection of David Connolly as the next administrator.  Crossbench and opposition members claim the government has used parliament this week to avoid accountability over the selection, which has come under intense scrutiny.  Political reporter Jack Hislop has the details for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Hundreds of agents ordered out of Minneapolis in wake of civilian killings | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Donald Trump's border czar has ordered hundreds of federal agents to withdraw from Minneapolis amid sustained pressure in the wake of the killing of two civilians by immigration officers.   While the president has suggested a "softer touch" may be needed in the city, he's vowed to remain tough on immigration. Guardian US politics reporter Shrai Popat spoke to The World. title: People's Party co-founder says Thailand election is "time for change" | The World | ABC NEWS
description: As Thailand prepares for hold elections on Sunday, a progressive political force that swept the 2023 election is now leading the pack. Three years ago, the Move Forward Party was opposing the military's grip on government and promising to reform a law that criminalises any insult aimed at the monarchy. Despite winning a popular mandate, it was forcibly dissolved twice by a conservative court. It's now known as the People's Party, but its co-founder, billionaire businessman Thanathorn Juangroongruangkit is banned from contesting this election. The ABC's Asia editor Karishma Vyas caught up with him in southern Thailand. title: Museum designed for blind tourists offers new way to experience art | The World | ABC NEWS
description: For many people, a trip to Italy to visit the Colosseum is a bucket-list experience. But for a growing number of the population who live with a disability, a lack of access can make those dreams almost impossible to achieve. Now, some guides and venues are choosing to do things differently, offering a new way to experience Italy's iconic art and architecture. Rebecca Johnston reports. title: US-Iran nuclear talks: Uranium enrichment, ballistic missiles high on agenda | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The US and Iran have agreed to hold talks in Oman on Friday, officials for both sides said, even as they â€Œremained at odds over Washington's insistence that negotiations include Tehran's missile arsenal and Iran's vow to discuss only its nuclear program. The delicate diplomatic effort comes amid heightened tensions as the US builds up forces in the Middle East and regional players seek to avoid a military confrontation that many fear could escalate into a wider war. The World's Girish Sawlani spoke with international politics expert Professor Simon Mabon on what to expect from these talks.
